alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 25 at 9:07PM EDT until October 26 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: .A developing low pressure system over the Atlantic will track northward and bring another round of deep tropical moisture over the region Wednesday into Wednesday night. This will bring the potential of heavy rainfall across the watch area. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Coastal DownEast, Far Eastern, and Interior DownEast Maine, including the following areas, in Coastal DownEast Maine, Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington. In Far Eastern Maine, Northern Washington. In Interior DownEast Maine, Central Washington and Interior Hancock. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Potential heavy rainfall with general totals of one to two inches and isolated totals of two to three inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Northern Washington
